metadata.name: Etheral Eruptions #19
metadata.description:
Etheral Eruptions

The artworks in this collection beckon viewers to gaze upon the transcendent, as ethereal eruptions unfold in an ethereal palette, challenging the boundaries of reality and perception.

"s" save canvas

Widescreen canvas resolution: 2700x2700 pixel

metadata.name: Chasing the Sunset #75
metadata.description:
Chasing the Sunset

"Chasing the Sunset" explores the timeless pursuit of capturing the sun's fleeting beauty as it rises and sets, reminding us of the constant ebb and flow of time and light

"s" save canvas

Widescreen canvas resolution: 6720x2523 pixel

metadata.name: Rainy Street #4
metadata.description: I use Navy Blue,white,gray,and black to show the street is rainy and wet.

metadata.name: gwynt #78
metadata.description:
Windy conditions

License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: looking through a glass #8
metadata.description:
or life is a colorful mess
or not your usual generative forest

this art project continues the path that 'life is a (beautiful) mess' began with the representation of our lives using drawing lines that make repetitive patterns
as life develops, we look at it through the glass of our unique existence. every event, emotion and thought we experience stain our personal glass and conditions our regard towards the world that surrounds us
the cercles in every composition, represents that glass that we all have between us and the world, and the movement of the lines under it, life developing as we observe it
or it's just another figurative generative art project, as you wish...

10 different palettes
over 30 different color pens
single or multiple color glasses or cercles option
press [1], [2], [3], [4] keys to multiply resolution and reload the piece
press [s] to capture an image .png
press [r] to reload the animation
click the mouse to stop the drawing
doubleclick the mouse to resume the drawing

generative art created by mehno using p5js

metadata.name: Movement #8
metadata.description: Movement

metadata.name: Movement #114
metadata.description: Movement

metadata.name: Movement #132
metadata.description: Movement

metadata.name: Movement #199
metadata.description: Movement

metadata.name: pointillism in lines  #12
metadata.description:
This painting is drawn in pointillism style.
which includes 14 layers.
The first 10 layers contain pointillism drawings and the 11th layer is the patterns of each line.
In the 12th layer, there are 30 covers made of different geometric shapes and brushes.
And noise and frames are used in the last two layers.

metadata.name: Layers #30
metadata.description:
It's the first time I really delved into studying about P5JS

I spent the last one collecting generative art and it made my passion for all this just grow, as a collector I wanted to move forward and want to do something more and so developed this project. 

I've been a designer for almost 10 years, an art director for over 1 year, I work all day with design every day, Photoshop and its infinite layers haunt me all day, as my passion wanted to insert something related there in my work so I thought of "layers" and thus "Layers" was born, layers and layers, specifically of rectangles one on top of the other forming the interactions of this work.

5 Styles:

Dunes:
Curves, some sharp and others less so, some remind me of sand dunes.

moiree:
It reminds me a little of compositions with a Moiré effect, forming curves where there is the presence of shadows giving relief.

Arranged:

A style where there is a certain organization of lines, but not perfect.

Strips:

Strips of colors on top of each other.

Harmonic:
It forms flat compositions, they are more organized layers.


17 Color Palettes based on famous works such as paintings and compositions:

"Mondrian - Composition with Large Red Plane, Yellow, Black, Gray and Blue / Piet Mondrian"
"Monalisa - Leonardo da Vinci"
"Portrait - Van Gogh self-portrait / Van Gogh"
"Venus - The Birth of Venus / Sandro Botticelli"
"Memory - The Persistence of Memory / Salvador Dalí"
"Son - The Son of Man /René Magritte"
"Guitarist - The Old Guitarist / Pablo Picasso"
"Canna - Red Canna / Georgia O'Keeffe"
"Drowning - Drowning Girl / Roy Lichtenstein"
"American - American Gothic / Grant Wood"
"Sunrise - Impression, Sunrise / Claude Monet"
"Creation - The Creation of Adam / Michelangelo"
"Girl - Girl with a Pearl Earring / Johannes Vermeer"
"Square - Black Square / Kazimir Malevich"
"Wave - The Great Wave off Kanagawa / Katsushika Hokusai"
"Wanderer - Wanderer above the Sea of ​​Fog / David Friedrich"
"Scream - The Scream / Edvard Munch"

"Layers" uses grains/noises function by Gorilla Sun, thanks for sharing your article with us! Article https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/all-about-that-grain

Created with p5js / Alex Benedith

metadata.name: Poem Of Atoms #113
metadata.description:
There is a force in the universe that binds everything together
It's a electronic web that connects everything in a delicate balance. 
Some call it fate. But few know the truth.
They are the lifeblood of our society, and they are what keep us moving forward. We are constantly surrounded by them, and they are always changing. It's not a force, it's an orbit. And the dots are the energy sources.

Made with P5js

metadata.name: rtrdgtzr #5
metadata.description:
“And in the bloodlit dark behind his eyes, silver phosphenes boiled in from the edge of space, hypnagogic images jerking past like a film compiled of random frames.”
William Gibson, “Neuromancer”, 1984


rtrdgtzr (/ˈɹɛ.tɹoʊ ˈdɪdʒɪtaɪzə(ɹ)/, pronounced same as retro digitizer) is a long-form collaborative collection celebrating pixel and glitch art, graphics from the '80s and '90s, and techno-dystopian aesthetics of William Gibson's novels. What you see when you open the minting interface is an editor which takes an input image provided by the minter, applies generative post-processing to it, and finally outputs an animated composition. The input image itself is compressed and stored on-chain through params mechanic as a signal in string format, retrieved every time the artwork is regenerated. Minters are in fact authors of minted tokens, implicit collaborators, who are appropriately entitled to half the royalties. To facilitate co-creation, minting process provides an intuitive interface as well as WYSIWYG (what you see is what you get) for full control of the output. Effect stacks in rtrdgtzr were originally developed for the ǥᵍłˡŧᵗȼᶜħʰvᵛɍʳsˢ collection released on GlitchForge in 2023 and feature customized diffusion dithering and aberrated pixel sorting. In terms of narrative and aesthetics, these two collections form an artistic continuum.

Minting interface is designed to guide the minter through the whole process in a user-friendly way. Quick visual guide as well as technical aspects of the collection are described in detail in the accompanying fx(text) article “rtrdgtzr – Minter’s Guide”. Please read it before proceeding with the mint. For more info on the curation process, please follow us on social media. If you want to contribute as an artist, reach out!

The collaborative minting process was greatly inspired by “Universal Rayhatcher” from Piter Pasma and “Pensado a mano” collections from Alejandro Campos, both innovative at the time in their use of params mechanics. As we see our support for open generative tools as a mission every generative artist should partake in, rtrdgtzr is also an official entry to the fxhackathon 2023: co-creation interfaces. We hope its openness and experimental character will serve as inspiration to others. But primarily, we hope it will inspire artists who don’t work with code to contribute to it.


Key controls:
g: export gif animation (current output scale)
s: export png image (current output scale)
left + right arrow: change output scale (1x-10x)
b: toggle page background color
p: pause / run animation

NOTE: Minting should be done from a desktop device as the interface does not support mobile browsers (unless you find a way to drag-and-drop the image onto the canvas, in which case you’re good to go).

Created with p5.js in 2023 by {protocell:labs}.

metadata.name: tratti #227
metadata.description:
"tratti" is an Italian word that has many different meanings. When we started working on this piece, we wanted to create something that combines our traits ("tratti" in Italian).
We had this urge to channel the turbulent times we're living in now into this artwork using just lines ("tratti" in Italian).

We don't know what to do now, we're here, and that's all that matters. We're here for our families, our friends, and our community. Like everything in life, there are joyful times and challenging times. We must accept happiness as something that is not constant but that we feel at times (a "tratti" in Italian).

With "tratti", we want to send a message to every disheartened human being: "Stay strong and never let anyone or anything crush the hope in you. Joyful times are around the corner".

---- 

© 2022 — Alessandro Fiore x Emanuele Pasin
LICENSE.md for detailed licensing info
